meanings.definition: A high, pointed piece of rock.
meanings.sent1: The climbers reached the pinnacles of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The birds nested on the pinnacles of the cliffs.
meanings.sent3: The goats played a game of 'king of the pinnacles' on the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The castle stood tall like a row of pinnacles against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the pinnacles, casting long shadows.

meanings.definition: The most successful point; the peak.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, she finally reached the pinnacles of her career.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their victory at the pinnacles of their success.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that reaching the pinnacles of fame meant more paparazzi.
meanings.sent4: His speech reached the pinnacles of inspiration, moving the audience to tears.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece was the pinnacle of creativity in the gallery.
